herald-review.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website for the Herald & Review, a daily newspaper covering the Central Illinois city of Decatur and surrounding Macon County.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Herald & Review is owned by Lee Enterprises, a publicly held company that owns more than 40 daily newspapers, including The St. Louis Post-Dispatch. Lee Enterprises’ media properties generate revenue from advertising and subscriptions to their printed and digital editions.

Herald-Review.com derives revenue from advertsing and subscriptions.

Content

Herald-Review.com publishes staff-produced articles focused on Dacatur, Illinois, and the surrounding area, which includes the state capital, Springfield. The site divides content into sections including News, Obituaries, Entertainment, Lifestyles, Business, Sports, and Opinion.

Opinion pieces are a mix of staff and syndicated columnists, plus Letters to the Editor. The sports section offers extensive coverage of the local Millikin University and University of Illinois teams.

More in-depth stories often include interactive features, and for all stories, readers can post  comments at the end or register reactions using various emojis.

Credibility

Articles on the site are largely produced by staff journalists, and are based on firsthand reporting. Headlines and articles are measured and fact-based. Opinion content is published separately from news content.

Herald-Review.com posts a corrections policy along with a pledge to adhere to the tenets of ethical reporting as defined by the Society of Professional Journalists.

Corrected stories run with a note at the end, describing the earlier error and how it was corrected. Corrections also run as standalone briefs.

The Herald & Review was one of 10 papers in the U.S. awarded a 2017 grant for “watchdog training” by the nonprofit Investigative Reporters and Editors (IRE.) The grants are awarded to news organizations who demonstrate a “strong commitment” to in-depth journalism, according to IRE. The newspaper also has won multiple statewide awards from the Illinois Press Association.

Transparency

Stories are bylined, accompanied by reporters’ email addresses. The Contact a Staff Member page lists managers, top editors, and reporters, along with contact information. Advertising is distinguished from news content.

The site discloses its ownership by Lee Enterprises only in a small copyright notice at the bottom of the menu and in the Terms of Service page. Asked about the site’s ownership disclosure, Editor Chris Coates told NewGuard in an email that he would present the issue to managers at Lee for possible tweaks to its disclosure.

History

The Herald & Review was created when Lee Enterprises purchased the paper in 1979 and merged it with weeklies Decatur Review and the Daily Herald. The website launched in 1996.
